TopicTitle: Any planet mods, besides Odysseus and Krag's PlanetFactory?

Articles.Content: They are great planet mods, but I want to see more. It would be AWESOME to have binary planets! Or comets, and close-to-the-sun-planets, and stuff like that. That would be awesome!
I think there's nothing that will suit you that's existing. Sorry

Well I know of the outer planets mod but it adds 3 gas giants but no moons and has the optional option of moving Eeloo out beyond these 3 giants.

It makes the kerbol system more like Sol

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/104280-0-90-Outer-Planet-Mods-Expands-the-Kerbol-system-with-new-planets-based-on-Saturn

StarSystems

Outer Planets Mod

Kopernicus Core (has a lot of planet packs)

StarSystems

Outer Planets Mod

Kopernicus Core (has a lot of planet packs)

Is there a way I can get them to work together? Also, how do you make planets?

Is there a way I can get them to work together? Also, how do you make planets?

Read the Kopernicus Core (link in my sig) tutorial on how to make planets. There are currently 4 Kopernicus packs (PFCE and Kopernicus don't work together, StarSystems doesn't work with Kopernicus):

Stella Expansion (Link in my sig)

Odysseus

Jool+ (Link in my sig)

Outer Planets (link in my sig)

Kerbol Planet Pack

Edited January 11, 2015 by _Augustus_

Read the Kopernicus Core (link in my sig) tutorial on how to make planets. There are currently 4 Kopernicus packs (PFCE and Kopernicus don't work together, StarSystems doesn't work with Kopernicus):

Well, that's a bit too complicated for me. Also, doesn't RealSolarSystem turn Kerbin into Earth and stuff like that?

Well, that's a bit too complicated for me. Also, doesn't RealSolarSystem turn Kerbin into Earth and stuff like that?

No.

Don't ever assume that..

No.

Don't ever assume that..

But I saw a mod that did that and it was called Real Solar System

But I saw a mod that did that and it was called Real Solar System

You are correct, Astrogamer. Also, your youtube is awesome!

You are correct, Astrogamer. Also, your youtube is awesome!

Really? Thank you! That's so heart warming to hear that!

RealSolarSystem only edits stock planets if you tell it to. Kopernicus Core distributes a special config that just edits the stock planets' atmosphere colors (no more white haze on Kerbin), and adds terrain to the new planets.

This is common knowledge and NathanKell himself has told people this.

Oh, ok. I get it.
